covered: Valid Payload: Scenarios TC01 (minimum fields), TC03 (only required header), TC02 (all fields), TC07 (extra fields ignored), TC11 (large payload), TC16 (partial input), TC20 (integration retrieval) cover successful creation with various payload shapes and post-creation retrieval.
Validation/Invalid Payload: TC05 (malformed JSON), TC06 (missing required Account fields), TC12 (empty payload), TC15 (XSS/injection in fields) demonstrate input validation and security handling.
Header Validation: TC04 (missing required header), TC08 (header value types invalid) cover header validation errors.
Authorization: TC09 (unauthorized access) confirms proper 401 handling when auth fails.
Error Handling/Resilience: TC10 (system down / DB unavailable) and TC14 (slow network / timeout) cover server resilience and timeout scenarios.
Duplicate Handling: TC13 (duplicate data) tests policy-driven outcomes (201 or 409).
Performance/Concurrency: TC18 (concurrent requests) tests throughput under load.
Regression/Consistency: TC19 (previous issue regression) ensures previously fixed behavior remains correct.
Integration/Retrieval: TC20 (retrieve created account via GET) validates end-to-end flow.
gaps: Caching behavior: No tests verify caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or client-side caching implications.
Rate limiting / throttling: No explicit tests for rate limiting or 429 responses under burst requests.
Additional authorization scenarios: While TC09 covers unauthorized, there are no explicit tests for forbidden (403) or scoped/role-based access control.
Data type validation beyond payload shape: Some payload-type edge cases (e.g., incorrect data types inside fields) could be covered more explicitly beyond malformed JSON.
Edge-case payload validation: While many payload variants exist, explicit tests for boundary values of specific fields (e.g., numeric ranges, string length limits) could be expanded.
recommendations: Add tests to verify caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) on successful responses and ensure proper cache behavior.
Introduce rate limiting tests to validate 429 responses or throttling under high load.
Add a forbidden (403) authorization test to cover insufficient permissions scenarios.
Enhance payload-type validation tests to cover incorrect data types within valid structures (not just malformed JSON).
Include explicit field-boundary tests (e.g., max/min lengths, numeric ranges) for critical Account fields to strengthen validation coverage.
